metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1728 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) implementation in Apple iOS before 9.2.1and Safari before 9.0.3 mishandles the "a:visited button" selector duringheight processing, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtainsensitive browser-history information via a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1728` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.10.6-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.10.6-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.10.6-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.10.6-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.10.6-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.10.6-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkit2gtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.6-1ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
